intro: Bladhia amboinensis, commonly known as the Amboina bladdernut, is a flowering plant native to the Maluku Islands in Indonesia. It belongs to the family Hippocastanaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and showy, yellowish-orange flowers. The plant produces woody, spiny fruits that contain several seeds. It is often found in tropical rainforests and is valued for its ornamental appeal. Due to habitat loss and overharvesting, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
